title: iPhone X... Where‚Äôs the love?
text:
********
iPhone X users, switch to the mydlink app!
********

I‚Äôve seen this app get updated a few times since I bought my cameras (DCS-8000LH).  However, it still doesn‚Äôt support the screen size of the iPhone X.  In that very same time, Netflix has gone crazy with updates for the iPhone X.  It seems like every other week I get one.  If Netflix can do it, why can‚Äôt D-link?  Also, I agree with many others that the cameras need to capture a small low res picture of what is detected, and that needs to be in the notification sent to the phone.  Then, we can decide if we need to open the app and take more pictures or even record.  Because the cameras don‚Äôt store pictures or video themselves, or to the cloud directly, we‚Äôre at the mercy of the app‚Äôs ability to load in a timely fashion and to finally give us the ability to store them (and it‚Äôs only to the phone storage).  I get that these are budget cameras, and that they‚Äôre ‚Äúcost optimized‚Äù.  However, I‚Äôve been caught at the loading screen of the app while someone is entering into my residence.  In some cases they‚Äôre in and out before the app finishes loading.  This is why we need the cameras to at least take a low res picture when they detect something.  If it can‚Äôt be in the notification, then allow us to enter an email address that the cameras can send pictures to.  Then you don‚Äôt have to worry about storage concerns or cloud server overhead.  Surely the cameras can do that much?

Also, some complaints.....  because how can you fix a problem you don‚Äôt know about?

1.  Your phone reps should never ask you for your password.  They are known to do this during troubleshooting.  I‚Äôve asked 2 of your reps about this and they claim it‚Äôs normal.  Furthermore, they state none of that is recorded in their notes, but yet I can hear typing over the phone.  Call me paranoid, but no company should ever ask for my password.  It just raises too many security concerns, but D-link should already know this right?  After all, your selling ‚Äúsecurity‚Äù cameras.  If you must access the account, reset the password and test.  Never ask.

2.  These cameras don‚Äôt work consistently because of the cellular carriers.  Each time a cellular carrier does an update that blocks access to your cloud, we lose all functionality.  Your reps state this to be correct.

3.  Why does your notification server go down so much?  If I can‚Äôt get stable notifications that my cameras have detected something, that makes them complete useless.  You need a failover solution.  I‚Äôve already seen this happen well over 5 times, and I‚Äôve only owned the cameras for a few months.

4.  Why do I receive notifications when the cameras switch to night mode?  I don‚Äôt need to know when they switch to night mode.  I only need to know when they detect something.

title: Slow login, lots of false notifications
text:
The app is okay and very basic, but since it has to login to your dlink account each time, it's very slow to access your cameras. I now mainly use a third party app (LiveCams Pro) that's much better (launches quickly and almost instantly shows me the live feeds of my six cameras all on one screen).

This app will notify you of motion detection and when it works, it's great, but you get a ton of false hits, and I get a lot of "camera disconnected" alerts which don't seem valid (the camera feed is there when I check). There's no way to turn off just camera notifications and leave the motion ones as far as I can tell.

To be fair, dlink has improved the app since I got it. You can now do things like firmware updates via the app, which it didn't used to let you do. I also had two newer model cameras that I couldn't get the dlink Mac software to initialize so I couldn't add them to my dlink account and therefore they wouldn't show up here in the app. (The cameras worked fine in my third-party app.) But then a new update to this app suddenly saw the two missing cameras and allowed me to set them up from this app, a big improvement.

text: Yes this app works but‚Ä¶ It was not an easy set up. My set up is a DCS-2310L outdoor cam with 10MB cable modem plugged into apple airport extreme. The reason we purchased your camera was to give us the ability to view it from our smart phones at any time, any place we had internet connection. I was deeply saddened when I had to remove your camera from our wall and box it back up. I am VERY sad that today I will be exchanging it for another brand. 

Because we honestly were SO impressed and pleased at the quality of the camera itself, I wanted to reach out to you and suggest that your company makes some serious improvements to the IOS app. The app reviews are very poor, as many other users seem to have experienced the same issues I do. 

Thank you for taking the time to read this. I hope you all have a wonderful day! :)

title: They added audio!
text:
D-Link added the ability to stream audio when viewing the camera through this app... thank you!!!

Having the ability for the camera to send email alerts when audio is detected above a configurable threshold would be amazing... sadly, the new cameras I just bought from you don't have that feature.  These types of features would really make your products stand out compared to the other manufacturer's IP cameras.  Don't overlook the little stuff, your customers want and appreciate feature-rich products!  How about the ability to view more than one cam using split screen?

But in general functionality, this system works very well. I view the cameras I have over 3G all the time. For what I paid for everything, I'm very happy with this system.

title: App is OK, Cameras are trash
text:
I have three DCS-930L's and two DCS-932's. If the power goes out or the router reboots, all the cameras cannot restart their web service communication which knocks them all offline until I power cycle them. They will reconnect to the router and I can view them locally but they all will drop their ability to be viewed remotely. This is a known problem with D link cameras and they seem to not care enough to fix this via firmware. 

The app has no ability to enable or adjust settings for the snapshot feature. This is the feature that can automatically take a photo(s) if motion is detected. The only way to configure this is by logging into each camera manually via a web browser. They need to add this feature to the app so I can toggle it remotely. 

The added ability to record from the app is nice. My biggest problem is the reconnection issue. This makes these cameras not reliable if you want to leave them in a remote location. Please fix this DLink!

title: Good app, could be great
text:
I like the app, just wish these features could be added (where  it can supported in the camera firmware.)

1) Please make it possible to share a specific camera with other MyDlink user accounts so that you don't have to share your credentials and all the cameras tied to an account. There would be a share feature where you'd select a contact from your device and the app would send an email inviting them to share that camera or cameras. 

2) Add a snooze feature to the motion alerts so that the user can instruct the app to temporarily ignore motion events from specific cameras for a specified time period (e.g. 1 hour)

3) the camera should not only send motion alerts to the smartphone, but accompany it with an image of the motion so that the user can quickly determine whether to ignore the alert without the need for opening the app and connecting to the camera

4) Allow users to set the motion detection cells and adjust overall sensitivity level 

5) Allow users to manually adjust sensitivity for specific cells

6) there should be a motion activity log for each camera, and a combined list of all motion alerts with a little thumbnail focused on the area in which the motion was detected. When tapped it should open a full-frame of the captured motion activity.

title: Great App and Camera!
text: Despite all the negative reviews this is a great app! I had the trouble with the ? And not being able to use the cameras but all is well now. Sometimes tweaks don't always work. They may work in a controlled environment but not in the consumers hands. So I expect there to be some bumps. It works great on my iPhone 5! It loads up quick and I am viewing in seconds whether I am in my home network or on LTE. It also works great on my iPhone 4 also.  I do wish the would update the app to take advantage of the screen real estate on the 5 though. All in all it does what it says. The snapshot is also a great feature for the times you are watching and motion detection doesn't catch it because it is to small and far away to pick it up.

title: It's ok, does what it says
text: Could be better? Could be native ipad/iphone, could record video locally, could have a nicer interface.. All other complaints are not about the app, but related to the mydlink service which sometimes fail to connect, or the camera image quality and audio quality.. If you really want this, then get a better camera and a faster internet connection, and connect directly to your camera via router port forwarding. Otherwise, the camera and the app serve its purpose. I' m actually going to buy a couple more cameras to watch other rooms while I'm away. People have to start giving reviews to the app instead of criticizing the hardware and underlying internet services.

title: Slow Connections
text:
First, my camera has a static IP address.  Why does this app need to search for it after every launch?  Just let me enter the information manually instead of using its braindead, hideously slow, autodiscovery.  If I open the app it's usually because I want to see something that is going on at that very second; by the time it actually locates the camera what I wanted to see has already concluded!

Second, I *ONLY* access my camera locally and have no intention of creating an account to use with D-Link's web-based services.  Why does the app begin with a splash screen asking for a login and password for the website instead of just immediately letting me view my camera locally?

Provide a means for me to bypass autodiscovery and add a camera manually.  By attempting to make it easier to use you have made it worse for people who do not need their hand held through the setup process.

title: Works 50% of the time, no customer service
text: Had a pair of DCS-5010L cameras for almost a year now. The main reason I went with the mydlink setup was for the app. I check the cameras a few times a day, pretty much everyday. About half the time the app will not connect to cameras, giving an unending connecting notice, or just an outright error message. This will happen no matter how close or far I am away from the house. I constantly cannot connect to the cameras while sitting in my driveway. One of my cameras has a broken microphone and I've tried twice now to contact drink through their website since it should still be under warranty. I've yet to receive a reply back, going on two months now. When the cameras and app work, then its a handy device and app. But the error rate with connectivity is extremely high and the company behind them has no customer service to back them up after purchase.

title: Banner won't stay down??
text: Glad to see they finally fixed the issue where the app was displaying the password. I just had to reinstall this app on a new phone. Seems like it is working better than ever. Except one issue...the banner with all of the controls that appears along the bottom of the screen. It used to be that you could tap on it and it would go away (and stay away until you needed it). Now it seems that it drops down for a few seconds and then returns. This is very bothersome considering that when the phone is turned to landscape, the banner always covers directly where my baby's head is. What a pain to have to tap on the screen and drop the banner EVERY TIME I want to quickly glance in on the baby. Am I missing something? Is there a way to keep the banner down or change a setting??

title: Terrible last update
text: I am very disappointed with the last update. I am experiencing a multitude of problems that I never experienced before. Sound comes and goes as it pleases. The one finger motion turning is awful. The little box in the top left-hand corner that shows you where the camera is going to look is just stupid. At least with the arrows you could still see where the camera was moving, but with the little box in the top you can't see where the viewport is going to land. I can't enlarge the picture without moving the camera because of the motion finger turning. I finally get the picture where I want it, but I can't enlarge it because it keeps on moving the stupid camera every time I put my fingers on the screen!!!  I continually have to refresh going in and out of the application because it tries to continue to stream but then it crashes. I completely wish I could go back to my previous version!!!!!!!!!

title: Buyer beware, Models advertised are not actually supported on newer hardware versions
text:
Buyer beware, the app says it works for your model of camera.   Then when you‚Äôre asked  for a hardware version, mysteriously version B isn‚Äôt supported, only version A.  Call it a model version, call it a hardware version, the box advertises a picture of a mobile device, the app advertises support for the model I bought.   Clearly neither are true. Hopefully the lawyers will have a field day with it and make a pretty penny from dLINK.   That will be satisfaction enough for me.

title: If I could leave no stars
text: I have had nothing but problems with this system the whole system , from the start. I should have trusted my instinct and returned it then but I went through tech support (slapping my head) and at least got it running. For some reason when I switched phones my camera is absolutely useless. So an update in my products cannot be the issue it is the camera and the app that is the issue . Light is green , won't connect to app nothing recognizes anything. Many are being sold on a free service but what is it worth if it doesn't work when you need it most . Nothing worse than something happening at home and you needing to check the camera and oh it doesn't work !!!!!!!!! I have resorted to junking this $200 camera out of satisfaction for all the aggravation it has given me , and purchased a reliable system . Please do yourself a favor and return it if you have time .

title: Crash on startup
text: I have a iPhone 5S and a iPhone 6 Plus. I've always had problems with the application crashing or not being able to view my Cameras.  I have a total of 12 Cameras that I use for personal security. The iPhone 6 Plus was not able to login automatically so I had to keep putting in my email address and passwords which was very frustrated.   After the latest release and reading reviews, I was able to upgrade and was able to log on automatically with the 6Plus.  At this point everything seems to be working just fine. My only recommendation is before you make any changes is to always check the reviews to see what other people are experiencing before upgrading your app.  Good luck.

title: Just one little fix to make it perfect!
text:
This app easily connected to our DCS-936L camera to watch our little girl while a babysitter was at our place.  

The biggest gripe is that when you are watching the live stream and you want to see a bigger picture, you turn the phone into landscape mode.  This works fine, but the default state of the app in this orientation is to overlay the menu bar at the bottom of the screen.  This blocks the view of our daughter.  We can tap the screen to remove the menu bar, but then the bar returns to blocking our view after about 5 seconds. This should be reversed - the bar only appears when it is needed, or when the screen is tapped.  Otherwise, great app!

title: Glitchy and unstable at times
text:
Needs more development on the app to make it more dependable and faster. The app doesn't give you access to the more advanced settings for the camera. You have to access the advanced settings for the camera from your computer using Internet Explorer. Forget about using Chrome or Safari. All you can do with the app is view the camera and turn on/off the motion or sound detection. Everything else you have to access from your computer. The app does not always connect to the camera. I had to close and open the app a few times in some instances. 

I gave it 3 stars because you can access the camera and turn on/off the notifications. But that's it. I wish there's other features available and it's more dependable.

title: Great App and Camera
text:
not sure why this has so many negative reviews. I have not once lost connection nor have had any problems with the camera or app. I use it to monitor my dog when i'm away from home. you are able to set motion detection alerts and immediately start recording to a SD card that is used for playback. I also have alerts set for noise detection. The app does what it needs to do perfectly. 

People experiencing wifi issues might need to bump up their internet speed (i have 38mbps), change their router (i have a nighthawk) or implement wifi boosters (i have two across 1900sq ft). 

i have had no issues with this product whatsoever, and its a much better deal than a nest or arlo for what i use it for.

title: Best Camera App I've Used
text: We use this app as a baby monitor. For the first 3 years of my son's life, we used the very expensive Y Cam/Baby HD Wifi camera and app. It was so complicated only tech services could set up the camera on our network. It was constantly going off-line or unable to connect. We finally gave up and decided to go the "cheap" route. To our surprise, the $50 D Link camera and free app has been 100% more reliable than what we had previously. No, the picture isn't HD and the sound buzzes when it's at full volume, but it's completely stable and perfect for what we use it for- to make sure the kid is still in bed. 5 stars and 2 enthusiastic thumbs up.

title: Love the app & camera but poor customer service
text:
I've been using the DCS-5010L for a little over a year and I have no complaints. The camera works well.  Occasionally there will be an update where the pan/zoom acts differently than it should but with the next update the issue is usually fixed. I use my IPhone 6 and IPad to view the camera remotely.  The camera runs on my home wifi. 
*Beware, there seems to be zero customer service.  When I first got the camera I had trouble with the installation and after no response from 3 separate emails I finally gave up.  I was eventually able to trouble shoot it myself but I went almost a month before I could get it working.

title: Horrible, just horrible
text: App simply does not work. Starts to open and immediately crashes. All software is up to date. Customer "assistance" is no assistance at all whatsoever. They speak very heavily accented and broken English and after two phonecall a today totaling an hour and 49 minutes actively on the phone trying to get it working, they told me I should just "return the unit"- not because it was defective, because the equipment itself works fine- but because it does not do what it is advertised to do and they are unable to get it working with the app.  Wasted almost an entire day between trying to troubleshoot everything possible, make sure everything was updated properly and then finally call customer support and try all of their ridiculous "solutions", none of which actually solved the problem. It still does not work. The problem is the app. It does literally nothing.

title: No problems, but needs improvement
text: I haven't encountered any of the crashing issues that others are writing about, so far at least. But this app could use some major improvements. Someone else mentioned the settings bar that never goes away on landscape mode... Super obnoxious. It would be nice to be able to swipe left/right to go to different cameras instead of hitting the back button, which you can't do in landscape view. Also, I'd love to be able to set specific time in which the motion detection sends an alert. I don't need to be alerted that there's motion in the living room because I'm getting off the couch! I'm a little over 24 hours into having this app, and so far these are my main concerns/ things I would change. Otherwise, not too shabby.

title: Very buggy App!  Beware
text:
We've had issues on all devices running this app (2 iphones and 1 ipad) from day 1.  
Now, with the recent firmware release, the app has prompted us to update the firmware in both our cameras.  We did so, and it states that it completed successfully.  However, when we try to go into the cameras on one of the iphones, the Day/Night feature has what appears to be a caution triangle, and when you click on it, it prompts you to update firmware, again.  This occurs on both cameras, and clicking on upgrade firmware again does not solve the problem.  So now one of our phones cannot access the features of the camera while the other can.
myDlink refuses to respond to support requests, too.  Maybe they are overloaded with all of the bugs that have plagued this app?  The star-rating on this app is pretty accurate.

title: Works for me
text: Wow, so many bad reviews.  (Knock on wood) The app works fine so far on both our iPhones.  This rating is more about the whole setup, cams & software.  Very simple to install (20 mins per cam) and I don't consider myself skilled at all.  Instructions may be misleading for multiples, so I just installed each (2) as new, without downloading an additional software they offer (I only need monitoring, not recording).  For $90 a pop, with no monthly fee, this is a bargain if your expectations are realistic.  Just fyi, this is going through a Netgear router.  Nothing like watching (& hearing) our dogs (we now realized only one was the perpetrator) turn their room upside down from 3k miles away.

title: What's all the Fuss?
text: I have no problems with this application. I use it as a baby monitor and works perfectly as advertised. Over the last year and have added upgrades which worked perfectly. I was fairly surprised when I had the ability to update the camera firmware through use of the application. The day and I both works perfectly and I'm able to take pictures. I have no problem with the cameras motion sensors. The wireless nothing an option I have no problems with. I currently use power over ethernet in order to run the camera. Obviously the pictures and the video are more clear. Keep up the good work.

title: Excellent App - Simple & Few Problems
text:
I have been using this app for over two years now.  I have 2 wifi cams models 930dl and they work just great with this.  They were simple to set up and I get movement notices right at my phone.  This is an excellent app and has never given me any problems on my iPhone.

Update:  it appears the web interface has changed (for the poorer).  We used to be able set a focused point using the Java interface for movement. That is no longer available.  It appears when you set movement notification its for the whole camera view.  Another setting that I can no longer find is the brightness level.  These 2 settings were very valuable.  Too bad they are now missing. I've dropped this rating to a 3+ now.

title: Great features, hard to access without good signal
text: Really easy to access the camera's features: zoom, sound, still camera shot, and microphone. The only thing about this is that if you don't have good reception, you won't get motion detection notifications. Even if I can't access the video, I would still like to have the piece of mind that either there is or isn't any motion taking place. I left my cat alone for the weekend and didn't see that she had moved around much. Usually she will set off the sensor 4 or 5 times a day. That freaked me out, thought maybe she got trapped in a room or something worse. Just turned out that I had bad reception and she was totally fine.

title: Very Unreliable
text: I've owned two cameras for about six months now and I can't remember a day that I haven't had one or both cameras lose connection multiple times throughout the day. The resolution has gotten worse since updating the firmware about a month ago. These reliability issues are totally ridiculous, and very frustrating. I've read several other reviews that have been posted that demonstrate I'm not the only one experiencing these issues of terrible reliability on a regular basis, but it seems like D-Link does nothing to resolve them, and I can't tell if there's anyone at the company responsible for managing these complaints or taking ownership of resolving the problems. If you're reading this review prior to purchasing these cameras, take my advice and don't waste your time and especially your money.

title: Camera has worked 5% of the time since purchase
text: We purchased the camera, it would absolutely not connect with the app after trying everything in order 20 or more times. We gave up on it entirely thinking the app must need an update or something. A few months later there was an update. We linked the camera and after two weeks of the camera working, the audio streaming quit working. I tried everything that the troubleshooting options gave and nothing so I gave it a factory reset thinking I would just reconnect it and now the app will not connect with the camera just as it wouldn't from the beginning. This is a waste of money and it's just sitting in the floor like a brick. $200 plus camera should never have such terrible software. The two weeks that it worked were great. But I will NEVER buy another.

title: Auto login issue resolved
text:
This was a major fix and makes the app usable again. The interface looks great, as well as the new controls added.

The only issue I still see is trying to connect to a camera that is in my local network, I keep getting the Video Stream Lost error message - which I can get away by connecting through the Local Camera tab.

I guess this is probably why the tab was added in the first place, but it would be simpler if I could connect to the camera through the same interface regardless of whether is in local network or outside. Or my might also be a bug still to be fixed.

title: Sound's Broken
text:
I was happy to download the update that promised to "speed up" the connecting time... Well it sped up the "login" time (which wasn't that long to begin with), but didn't do anything for the absurd amount of time it has to think about connecting to the camera. Oh and it broke sound... Thanks for that. Would have been nice to know you planned on breaking that (the FAQ states that sound is "not supported" at this time... Well I promise you it WAS until it was broken). 

I'll give it two stars for the fact that video works to some extent. No multitasking, broken sound, and terrible connecting times are all negatives in my book.

So if you forked over the cash for one of these cameras because all the talk of mydlink sounded great... All is I can say is sorry, because now you're just stuck with mediocre crap.

title: Many problems with App and camera
text:
Purchased a DCS-936L as a less expensive addition to our three Nest Dropcams. I should have just gone ahead and spent the money for the Nest cameras and service. 

The app times out many times when I want to set the camera to record on movement or when it detects a sound. Now when I try to view the camera from the app, the picture comes up for about one second and then turns gray. I turned my phone off and back on and unplugged the camera and plugged it back in to no avail. I have had to reset the camera to factory settings once already in the two months I have had the camera because the camera lost connection with my router. 

This package is terrible and is not good for a remote camera in a vacation home. Go ahead and spend the money for a better system. I will.

title: Will this stop the pop ups?
text: I'm just completing this in hopes the stupid 'rate this app' pop up stops. I find it ridiculous that a company would practically force you to write a review about their product. Haven't I spent enough money on your products to not have to write a review? I have eight cameras and the record DNR. All works okay. Thanks to the DNR the green light blinks constantly and is annoying but maybe that's part of the feature? And to go online to set it up is not user friendly. On the box it says the cameras have speakers, so why doesn't the app have a mic option? I know other camera companies have this option. I wish I would have researched my options prior to buying everything but can't go back in time.

title: Stopped working after last update
text:
Since downloading the last update, the app won't let me view my cameras when connected to cellular data. Works fine when I'm on wifi though. Contacted support multiple times but they have been less than helpful. Many other users are having the same problem. Please fix asap!

Edit: The developer eventually fixed the app and the LTE issue. However, now the app will crash immediately after opening. I'm about to get rid of these DLink cameras and get something more reliable. A shame since the system was great when it worked. 

Edit 2: Well, the app is once again non-functional when connected to LTE on my iPhone. I've given up on DLink and replaced my cameras with another brand. I would never purchase another product from this company again.

title: Rating higher after getting support
text:
I had originally rated the software with one star because I could not connect to the camera if I was outside my local network and the camera was periodically disconnecting. A call to support had me reboot the camera and reinstall the dlink lite iOS app. It now works as advertised. It still is not a five star product because a) you can't turn the camera off via the app, b) there is not a convenient one button method to turn monitoring on and off, c) I have not been getting notifications due to movement, only those due to detecting noise. 
Outside of these issues, it has turned out to be a good product.

title: App crashes when viewing over cell data
text:
Please fix this app. The latest version crashes every time I try to view my cameras over cellular network with my wife's or my iPhones. Thank goodness, I don't have automatic updated installed on my iPad as the old version of the app still works perfectly on the cellular network.

7/9/17 It has been three months sine my last review and there has not been any update to the app or response from d-link, but there has been some improvement.  The software started working over wifi on all devices.  So far everything thing work perfectly on my old iPad (3rd generation with old software on att's network) . But the d-link app will not connect on iPhone 5s , 6, Se, 6s on t-mobile network. ( I did opt out of t-mobile video throttling to no effect.    I hope d-link addresses this issue.)

title: D-Link, Please, C'Mon Man
text:
As like the previous reviewers, I am also having problems after D-Link's latest update; my pre-sets are absent. Actually, there are problems after almost every update.

One example; though I like that the Motion and Sound Detection settings (Event Trigger Settings buttons) are now handy on the Ap', the problem is that, the Motion and Sound Detection buttons are very slow to populate, or do not populate at all, when I return back home, when my iPhone connects back to my very strong wifi. Also, the words used ("Enable" and "Disable") are not clear; what is clear is "On" or "Off".

I could go on and on, with how many times I've had to call D-Link in frustration. Instead, I'll simply express this: D-Link, please consider that we use your products to monitor our homes, in order to gain some form of security for our loved ones, and peace of mind for property protection. So, when you continue to perform failed updates, please consider that your competitors are improving.

I gave a rating of 3 of 5 Stars because I believe that D-Link is seeking to improve their product.

title: Great App for Nanny Cam Use
text: I know there were a lot of people saying this app is junk but to be honest I think it works great.  I have a regular wireless network in our house with an extender and the camera is super easy to set up. I set it up using the WPS button and it discovered my network within seconds. The quality of video is amazing. I've logged in using LTE and 4G from all over SF and the video and audio is great.   No complaints with one exception. The app should be able to allow the camera to pan while pressing the buttons rather than clicking it over and over. Please add this to the next update!! Then it be 5 stars!!

title: App needs help!  Works 50% of the time
text: I paid a premium for the camera w/ the pan, tilt options along w/ a night viewer can in order to check in while traveling to ensure the house, dogs & family are fine.  Half the time it works ... Sometimes it won't connect as it seems it can't find the camera.  This isn't the WiFi connection as I've got 2 other smart home apps which connect w/ no problem so its def the camera.  Even worse, when it does connect, the app feature supposedly allows you to manually swipe to tilt &/or pan the camera ... This feature simply has a mind of its own!  Sometimes it works but most times it's so irregular it's useless.  Then to add the cherry on top, it times out & then you have to do it all over again ... Very frustrating!!

title: Pretty darn good especially for the price
text:
well performing device with great software that allows me to control it remotely with ease. Only downside was that it does not have built in speaker. I was able to hook one up to it though, but it had to have its own power source. 

I am able to zoom around and change all the settings using my I phone which is neat. 
It also sent me an email when it lost internet connection, which i thought was very handy. 
Not the cheapest one out there but very reliable and at a decent price plus it is expandable to add more cameras, which I plan to get.

title: Excellent baby camera
text: We bought one of these about 3 years ago as a video monitor for our first son because it was so much cheaper without the word "baby" in product title.  We knew it was a trusted brand for a decent price. Well, 4 years later we have another one for our second baby. Even with the 3 year spread, they technology is consistent and reliable and uses the same app to sync online and on our phones so we don't have to have a separate device. That was a big selling point for us...our phones are the device, not a separate monitor you carry around.

title: Your Updates Scare Me!
text: Everything was great till I updated. Since then (and I've updated 3x), I stopped being hopeful & even scared cuz I need cams!! Still can't use back button or it freezes. I go out & takes 2 tries to get back in, taking valuable time to get in.  Now, latest update; Sound distorted, time delays in movement (let alone sound), "connecting" circles screen which freezes any movement & STILL can't use back button w/o freezing or being dropped.  Wish I'd NEVER updated cuz had absolutely NO problems or complaints. Please fix or give us option to reload old versions before you "tried" to fix everyone's issues. Come on guys.....it was good before. Edit/Undo!!! Please! I still have a bit of faith in you left. Don't you want good reviews? I remember them cuz that's when I purchased the equipment & downloaded this app.

title: This app does not work with IOS
text:
I have two cameras the DCS5222L and the DCS942L. The following occurs with my DCS942L. When I turn motion on or off from the mydlink lite app simultaneously motion detection sensitivity is changed from my custom setting of 70% to 30%. SD recording is disabled and my custom setting are not changed. I have updated the firmware using an ethernet connection. 

I received an RMA for my DCS5222L and the issue is not resolved. There is problem with the mydlink lite app or the firmware and not the camera. When I turn motion on and off using the app simultaneously video clip is changed from my custom setting of 3 seconds for pre event to 0 seconds pre event. Recording SD is disabled and all custom settings are returned to factory defaults. Motion sensitivity custom setting of 75% is changed to 30%. My DCS5222L is connected by ethernet cable and not wireless.

title: Cannot get it to work
text:
It has taken me an hour to get the camera set up. Had to use my cell phone and that app I downloaded to set up because my computer would met recognize the camera. When I did get it connected the picture was delayed and smeared and my app kept crashing. Very disappointed and will be returning both cameras. :( I tried contacting tech support and of course will not receive an email till tomorrow.
Update- I got it to work after updating firmware. However it does not record video to my computer. Had buy a separate app for that or dlink storage. I could not connect to it when I was away from my house and it only sent me an email once when there was motion. And I tested it and moved in front of it at different times. 
Still have not heard back from tech support.

title: Still needs work!
text: The sound doesn't work on my iPad2 ever since I first updated it about 6 months ago. It works on our iPhone 4s's. I want the sound back! Another issue, ever since the most recent update, the screen on my iPad2 dims and locks, just like it would if you were letting it sit idle too long while web surfing. It never did that before. It should never turn off unless you close out of it, since it is a camera feed and the reason you are using it is to monitor something. I actually had to go into my iPad settings and switch the screen to never lock. Very annoying and wish I had never updated it from the beginning. I am never going to update anything important without reading the reviews first!!

title: D-link having reviews deleted! üò°
text:
WHATS GOING ON?!!?  My 1 star review had been deleted!  I continually updated my review with each issue and today it was gone, but I noticed A LOT of seemingly bogus, positive reviews. SUSPICIOUS!

I'm about ready to ditch all our d-link cams (7) because their app continually has issues.  If not one thing another.  Anyone who says differently just hasn't had their product long enough, or wrote a bogus review.

Since my review got mysteriously deleted - I can only remember the last couple of major problems, and they all can't be blamed on a cellular carrier.  

We've had T-mobile for 19 years, through other d-link problems including earlier this year with their app crashing after opening and selecting a camera.  It seems when that issue was fixed - their developers screwed up something else.  This is NOT a T-mobile issue!  It's a d-link problem!  

On their own forums they claimed they were working on a fix - nearly TWO months ago!!  Still nothing!  It seems too easily convenient that all these positive reviews have popped up at the same time mine was deleted.

Fix your software d-link or we're moving to another.

title: Not reliable and not a good investment, needs work...
text:
I've had 8 cameras for several years now and still consider them unreliable.  Slow to connect, unable to connect, late or no event notifications, and offline are all common issues depending on the day, or time of day. Since I've invested in D-Links products It would be great if D-Link would invest some resources into making them right.
My 8 cameras are at 2 different locations and I have cameras go offline almost daily which requires the router to be restarted to regain access to them, my 4- DCS5222Lb's often go offline at both locations at the same time which tells me this is a DLINK issue, not a local network issue!  Hey DLINK, please get these issues figured out and fixed!!

title: Don't update presets gone, need it fixed now,
text: I don't understand why every time the app has an update, things that worked before no longer work?  And then it takes months for another update to fix it so it works again.  It seems like if you do an update that causes a bug, you should fix and get a new rev available adapt, or bring the old version back to the App Store.  This is the one app that I purposely never just update automatically because there's alway a major bug.  This time I forgot to not update it on my phone and I have no presets. I didn't update my iPad, and presets work great.  Dlink needs to put more emphasis or resources on their apps, or at least let beta testers test them before releasing to the general public.

title: A long way to improve.
text: Poorly designed. It's okay to start at adding a camera but it has to provide a way to jump out this 1st initial process. Not everyone needs to start at the beginning. In my case after I finally add one of my cameras, I can see a list of my others under the general interface. What a waste of my time to setup the 1st one. I could had a way to let it scan the whole environment and pick what it has found! Another issue is this app only recognizes default http port 80, which in contrary the camera web setup page allows ppt to change the port to other number. So if I changed the default port number for my safety concern, I cannot use this app any more caz it cannot connect to the camera anyhow.

title: New Update Horrendous
text: App worked marginally prior to update.  I used to have a few glitches, but at least it worked as intended most of the time. Now with the recent update, the camera and app are virtually useless. Continuous crashes, and constantly tries to connect to device, then fails. Once in every 10 or so attempts to view the live feed, it will successfully connect for about 3 seconds, then fail. Then will send a push notification about once every 10 minutes that the device has "been disconnected". Reinstalled app twice with no change.  Called technical support(foreign country outsourced phone support), and they were absolutely no help. They lied to me about trying to solve the issue just to get me to hang up. Very annoyed since now my $200 camera is basically useless.

title: Works well
text: Just installed on a vacation property earlier today and it has already emailed me that it detected movement on my porch! Caught the Yardman blowing leaves off the porch. I am pleased with the video and motion detection however it came preloaded with very old firmware and can't seem to upgrade. I have tried upgrading via the app...times out. Via the web dashboard on my PC...says upgrade failed. And tried hooking camera via cable directly to router and laptop via cable to router and still unsuccessful upgrading firmware. Went to DLink site and downloaded upgrade to my computer and still could not install to camera. Ugh!!!

title: More trouble than it's worth
text: Spent over 2 hours plus an hour with technical support on the phone trying to set the camera up. Support guy was sort of helpful. But he kept trying to get off the phone. "here's a case number if you need to call us back." I said "I don't need to call you back. I need to stay on the phone until we fix the problems." Anyway, I figured out how to get the camera to work. But only on my laptop in the same room with the camera. This app always said my camera was offline. Even when I was watching the image on my computer. I seemed to have many of the same issues as other bad reviews here. Oh well. Returning the camera. Deleting the app. I gave it one star because I was afraid zero stars wouldn't register.

title: Works decent, minor bugs
text: As far as monitoring the camera field of view when away, this app excels. I have noticed that the app to camera voice support doesn't seem to work at all unless we are on the same wifi network as the camera. I also noticed that the recordings time indication does not match the time indicated by the camera itself writing the file, making it difficult to pinpoint triggered events at the appropriate time to review the video. Other than that it works quite well. Looking forward to adding a couple more cameras to the network for other areas.

title: Works great!
text:
The most recent update of the lite version works great!  On the AT&T network the camera views are available within 3-4 seconds of choosing a camera to view while on the G network.  Wireless connection makes the views pop up almost instantly even on slower DSL connections.  I like the new layout because for me it allows for easier use of the zoom capability.  The snap shot feature works great too!

Yes, as other reviewers have mentioned, there are a couple of spelling errors.  However, for me the new version has been working great so far!

title: I see you now mr maintenance man!
text:
I like the app update that I can adjust more settings, but it must have a bug that keeps turning the motion sensitivity down to 30%? This DCS 5020L does the trick and seems to work very good. Now I can keep an eye on my apartment when I'm not home.
You see I have a problem with the maintenance people just coming into my apartment anytime they feel like it without giving any prior notice!  It's not that I don't trust them, I am just concerned if something would get broken they would probably deny it then I would have to fight it out with my renters insurance to cover the items!
DocCanFixIt

title: What a Hassle
text: Such a waste of my money and time. The most overly complicated way to access your camera from mobile devices. The resolution is set to 360x 240 which pretty much means pixel-ish video, and very delayed motion detector. I can't access the pics that were supposedly taken, the link to access that sends me to some shady page that my computer warns me four different ways not to enter. You're asked to put your log in info in, and when you Dom they ask for it again, and still nothing. Such a rip off, such a scam, and an even bigger disappointment. Luckily I bought this on Groupon to try their product out before getting  full system. It's getting sent right back and I'll be investing in one of their competitor's home security products instead.

title: Not a great app or camera
text: If you're using this camera or app for a dog it might be suitable but isn't suitable for any type of security measures. The app does have connection issues at times, notifies you of motion when there is no motion, and needs to have an updated features. There also needs to be better help documentation available on the features and how to use them. I had to spend too much time trying to figure it out on my own because there is no documentation One evening we continued to get alerts of motion and we finally figured out the camera was picking up lightning strikes. I think we're going to return the camera and look at other models to see if we can get better performance.

title: Cameras are great, set up is a bit tricky.
text: The cameras work great. I bought two so that I can keep an eye on the kids, pets and my home. I would say it is worth the money. If you follow the instructions set up is a breeze. I encountered some problems at first with set up through the phone app. Once I set it up online though the phone app picked up the cameras right away. All you need to do is follow the instructions given. There are various different ways to set up the cameras, so if one does not work you can try another. This is what I did and it works great! Very happy with the product!

title: Stay away!
text: Worst app and worst product ever.  Upon viewing any of the cameras I have setup the picture instantly freezes 100% of the time (and that's if it will even connect which is about 50% of the time), 75% of the time can't even get audio.  What a waste of money I flushed down the toilet on this.  I'm currently trying to view cameras while on a trip and I'm extremely frustrated.  The technology seems to be in its infancy and it's obvious the guys writing the firmware have no interest in improving robustness whatsoever.  It seems to be there is no clear winner in this market as each manufacturer (dlink, linksys, swann,etc) are only interested in inching ahead of the competition regardless of how crappy their products truly are.  If I could give this negative stars I would.

title: A temporary fix for those who can't connect on LTE
text:
After buying this cam and going through the setup process I discovered that I can't use it when I'm on LTE network which is making this a completely useless. It still works on wifi though. 
And I see a lot of people complaining about the same issue here. Well after couple of days googling the issue and not finding a solution, I found it myselfüôÇ For using it with an LTE network one only needs to setup a vpn connection on the iPhone and that's it, it simply starts working. Just download any vpn app from AppStore. One more fix I'd like to see in the next update it to be able to save files from camera to iPhone photos.

title: It was a breeze!
text: Setup was easy, works great! I can view it from the website on my Dell laptop, or my iPhone with this app.   We have 2 wireless routers so I did have to make sure the laptop was connected to the same router as the camera during setup & my browser needed a java update to view it on the website. The only cons are I wish the power cord for the camera had been longer and the white noise when you have the sound on can be annoying. The picture could have been better but for the price, I can't complain.

title: Updated review of version 3.0
text:
Holy wow!!!!  Did D-Link FINALLY figure it out after all these years?? This version actually works pretty good. I'm in shock!  I feel dizzy... Need cold water. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Updated review of version 2.6.0 (and previous versions):

2.6.0 = Still not getting the connection speed on LTE:  Only able to connect around 1-3 fps as opposed to 20 fps on LTE like I was getting on version 2.4.4 (best version so far)

2.4.4 = great connection speeds, but needs iPhone 5 support (full screen)
2.4.5 = FAIL
2.4.6 = at least it connects, but no LTE speed like 2.4.4
2.6.0 = new UI looks nice, but same problems as 2.4.6:  no LTE speed like 2.4.4;  needs iPhone5 support (larger display)

So far, 2.4.4 is the best version:  Able to get LTE speed connections with iPhone5 (15+ fps).  All other versions connects very slow (2-3 fps). 

Going back to 2.4.4 again until the devs can figure this out.  VERY FRUSTRATED with this app and their updates.

title: Great App
text: I have been using this camera and app for over 2 years now. We love it. We now have 2 cameras and It is so convenient to check on both our kids while in the house and outside the house. It's cool because my mom lives out of town and she often watches them sleep. One thing I will note is that I live in a large town home so usually it's easy to head then cry. If you live in a large home where you cannot hear your kids cry. You may need to have your app display on your iPad plugged up or on your Internet TV.

title: Love.... Wish you could save to iPad
text: Once I got through the tough part of setting it up online and figured out how to add the motion along with always record, I love it. I have an SD card that saves about 1 1/2 days before it overwrites. However, it would be great if you could actually SAVE a file to iPad or PC easily, without going into the setup. So if someone were to try to break in, I could have proof. As it is now I have to go into the setup on my PC and figure out which file it is to download. Can't you just have a button to save it after viewing? That would be great.

title: Exactly what I needed.
text:
Works with my 2 dlink cams well enough. Only time I have trouble is when my internet cuts - sometimes this requires me to "reset" the cam by turning it off and back on, which I can't do wirelessly. I don't feel like I'm missing any features, and the app itself is easy to use - haven't had any glitches.

I don't remember my camera models, but both have microphones and the sound comes through okay (a bit of white noise if my pets are quiet). Pan and tilt works quickly enough, but the sudden human-less movement of the camera initially creeped out my cat.

title: Sluggish, not working well
text:
I've been reading reviews that say the old version of the app used to work. I can't judge that since I just got two of these cameras.
Setup of the cameras didn't go well. Everything seemed designed to be easy, but the connection between my iPhone and the dlink server always timed-out, even though I was using a solid wifi connection.
Now that I have one camera working, the app is asking me to update that camera's firmware. Guess what? Over a half hour of watching the camera reboot itself later I'm waiting for the process to complete to the app's satisfaction.
I'm not impressed. I don't know if the problem is the app, their servers, or the camera, and I'm not in a position to diagnose it.
Don't buy one of these cameras.

title: Works Great!
text: I'm using a d-link router and it could not be easier.  Push a button on the camera and push a button on the Router and it is connected via Wifi. Then create an account go to the website and upload firmware update and camera is working.  It took less than 10 minutes.  If you are having the 60 second issue, it is related to the router used not the camera used.  This is totally awesome, could not be easier!

title: App has many issues
text: Concept is great, app regularly has problems. So often we can connect to one or all of our cameras, then 10 minutes later we can (no issues with our internet or modem), get loud ticking noise sometimes when doing multi-camera view, sometimes when logging back in the camera is not pointed where I left it.  App works very poorly and has so much more potential. You'd think with whats out there now a days they could hire someone better to make this app. If the cameras hadn't been so expensive or I had another app option I would definitely make a change!  Recommend looking else where for something easier and more reliable.

title: Working well except...
text: Just put some cams up and hook up was amazingly simple! I had just returned some other cams that were a nightmare to hook up.  The software downloaded to my iPhone and iPad easily and hooks up well to cams from anywhere. Only thing I am not happy about is the notifications not working. I understood these cams and SW were to detect motion or sound and send push notification either via email or text. It has not done either even w the feature turned on.  Maybe there is something I need to do via the website and not the app?

title: Crashed and crashed
text:
My update for the current version: it crashed everytime I re-open it. It works again if I restart the app. What an in convenienve.

This is my frustrating using this app. Every time I open it, it takes a long time to load. Once loaded, a touch to any function icons will just freeze the app. When try to pan or tilt, it might or might not work for the first time. And so likely that if the first pan/tilt works, the second one will just fail. I'd rather not use this app, and go straight to the web to view, even though it means a longer process to log in and wait for the images routed to my browser via the internet. It‚Äôs supposed to be a local network access since I'm using both Dlink cam and router. But for now, the only solution now is to go to the web and view live video over the cloud. 

One side note, the same app, but it works fine on an iPhone. WHY???????????????????????

The title says Useless, and I mean it literally.

If there were an option for not selecting any star, it would be my selection.

title: Exelent
text: MyDlink  , works  excellent.... however need some improvement when using WIFI -  60 second of time it's definitely bad idea.. On other hand perfect when using 3G .. Question for MyDilink ! Why not improve this ..? Just to let every one to know quality can be improve drastically in setting using  computer. In good detail ... Please read documentation ..... No secrets  .. For douse who can or care to read  instruction ..... after al it's security camera ... Just for authorize  users ..!

title: Could be so much more
text: Camera is not bad , software is weak on so many fronts. Would love to be able to set the points where the camera would automatically return to specific points in its rotation as moving the camera is cumbersome and slow, would be so much faster if once you fine tuned a location you could return to it by tapping a favorite key. Not having it send a snap shot of the motion event is just plain weak as this software is almost worthless for any type of security. Hopefully the company will take my suggestion and others and release something that is worthy of this product

title: Horrible cameras and app
text: Since it reminds you constantly to review the app instead of letting you view your cameras might as well do so. Both the cameras and app are bad. Cameras lock up almost daily and have to be power cycled. Firmware releases make everything worse. New warnings not to update over wifi so you have to make a really long Ethernet cable or physically uninstall cameras and power supplies to update firmware. Can take up to a minute or more, assuming it does not time out, to connect to a camera with the app. App will not let you view HD cameras in HD. Overlay in landscape mode blocks important parts of the picture. Forces you view a tutorial after every update and won't let you cancel when you need to quickly view a camera.

title: Latest update awful
text: Oh, how I wish I had not updated. Not getting notifications or still shots when there is movement most of the time. I might get 4 or 5 events noted during the day when there is definitely movement a couple of feet from the camera. When an event is saved, it has the wrong date and time. I've tried to fix that, but it keeps reverting back to incorrect info. Also, there's a it arrow on the event picture, so you can't actually see it unless you click on it to enlarge. Sadly, there is no way to undo the update. And, apparently there is no way to contact any support. I've tried that as well . In the app, support is just faq.

title: Easy and no problems.
text: Not sure why some folks have issues but I think it could depend on personal equipment we all have. Some systems are fussy and it's hard to get apps to work. My system likes this app and my camera is working great. I've videoed several neighbors going to and from all from the comfort of my living room. I'm hoping to catch a parcel thief. I bought this to find out who is taking packages from neighborhood doorways. We all are. So I'm hoping this continues to work as promised. So far so good.

title: Update needed!!
text: I bought the DCS ‚Äì 5222L and this app thinking I'd be able to use the two-way communicator. I have called dlink three times and was told that the mic should be in the app but it isn't. I was also told to do a firmware upgrade which my husband already did on the first phone call to support since we couldn't get the camera installed. Also, the email function does not work‚Ä¶ Would like to have the two way since that's why we bought it in the first place. Otherwise, camera works great, picture is sharp and clear. Oh and was told that you need to hook up a speaker to back of camera

title: Installed fine and working great...
text: I just installed my camera and before downloading the app I read neg reviews about sound being gone. PLEASE NOTE when I installed the app and saw video coming thru my device there was no sound in fact the sound icon was faded. Since I had my cam connected to my laptop with the Ethernet cable in, the mydlink website had told me to UPDATE my camera firmware. Once that was done, I relaunched the APP and voila the sound is there. So the app is fine its just the camera firmware. At least that's what it was for me. Hope this helps anyone.

title: Once was good now is crap
text: This application was amazing for years. Now here of late it's a big piece of garbage. Cameras when viewing remote are randomly unavailable. So when at home I unplug all 7 cameras ad plug them back in then they show but only for a short time. Dlink needs to fix this problem asap it's been progressively getting worse with each release since like 6 months now. Only reason why I got dlink cameras was cause of this app. Last I have a mix of different model cameras and all are doing the same thing. Locally the cameras are fine. Till this is fixed do not buy their cameras if you want remote viewing. If not fixed here soon I will have to find a better company to purchase my cameras from.

title: Meh
text: Had a drop cam. Loved it. Dropcam couldn't  rotate like the 5222l. That is a great feature you can't find anywhere else for this price. I can see most of my house. The app is not good. It really needs some work. But when it does work it is really nice. Company could use some help in the customer service department. All in all. Not a bad product but leaves a slight feeling that there is some thing left to desire. Also way more options than most on setting up the cam. To many to list but many many features. Just wish they would fix the mobil issues. I would recommend this product.

title: Great idea
text: I have owned two indoor cameras (933l) for about a year and they have worked great and were fairly easy to set up. I just bought an outdoor camera (2332l) and I am having a bear of a time getting it to run properly. I've been working with tech support and she is now telling me I have to reload the my dlink ap every time I change from mobile lte access to wifi. I'm weirded out by this so the verdict is out on this camera. May be sending it back. The indoor cameras have never had this requirement.

title: Works great, no clue why poor reviews
text: I always wonder what people do to their phones and how they struggle to work with something that's so easy to use. The app works great, the camera is so simple to setup and the fact I barely have any delay in streaming the camera makes this a great deal. I have multiple cameras using the app and it's flawless. I really feel bad for people who can't follow directions and succeed in setting this up. Life must be extremely tough for these negative people

title: Do NOT go near these cameras or apps!
text: I bought one today to monitor my 3D printer. Had I known I would waste my entire afternoon and evening trying to figure out how to set it up, then calling my router tech support, to whom I had to spend over $100 for an extended warranty before they would even look at the problem. Spent 2 hours on the phone with them just to get my home network to recognize the device, only to find out the apps are junk and failed to display one frame of video despite my multiple attempts. If I couldn't get a refund I'd chuck the dumb thing in the bin. As far as I'm concerned I'm returning this junk camera tomorrow, and D-LINK, you owe me me $120 for that useless waste of time and moneyon tech support! You ruined my Sunday!

title: This works really well
text: We needed a camera and found this one to work super well. It gives us the ability to view from any device from anywhere with ease. They also do a great job of updating the app, adding features and ensuring stability - which is WAY better than the last camera we tried from a different manufacturer, which never seemed to work. I've been using this one for over a year with great success and recommend it all the time.

title: What happened?
text:
Up until a few weeks ago, when my 930L camera and iPad or iPhone were on my home WiFi network, I could use this as a front door monitor, because I was getting 20 fps full-motion video plus I could watch indefinitely.  Now, it takes tens of seconds to connect, I get one or two frames every second, and it requires me to reconnect after 60 seconds (like being on cellular, where I might expect that).  What happened?  dLink -- please address this so I can use the camera again.

UPDATE:  I just located ver. 2.4.1 in my Mac's Time Machine backup from April, and installed that in place of 2.4.2.  Problem solved, for now.  It's working fine again.  Whew!

title: Negative reviews are isolated problems
text: The low rating definitely lowered my expectations of the app ( maybe that's why I think it's so good) but really...no problems. It's awesome. As for the panning and how you have to tap the arrows on your phone and the camera only moves an inch at a time, that is normal for remote controlled webcams from what I've experienced. The picture is really clear! And it uses a wide angle lens so you can see the whole room from a corner. This is one of the best thing I've spent money on in a while!

title: Don't update if you haven't already
text:
UPDATE: thought the new update would fix my previous issues.  Now instead of not connecting to cameras the app just crashes each time.  

If I could give zero stars, I would.  I invested $300 in cameras from Dlink this last year.  They worked well until the update a few weeks ago.  Cameras will not connect anymore unless you are on the same network.  Tried uninstalling apps/unplugging/resetting up the cameras from scratch which only fixes the problem for a few hours.  No help from Dlink support.  This is not isolated as I have family members across the US with the same issue starting after the update.  Now I am left with useless junk.

title: Worst app and camera combo ever
text: We bought this camera to use with our first daughter and liked it so much we bought another camera to add to it. Then, they did an update and it has been horrible every since. The "swipe" feature is way too sensitive, especially when you're trying to use it in the middle of the night half asleep. Also, since the update, it logs us out pretty much every time we use it and we have to put our email and password back in to view our child. Again, in the middle of the night, or anytime really, it's extremely frustrating. I would not recommend this setup to anyone at this point. We are thinking about buying a whole new system.

title: Frustrated
text: I had been using the app for several months, when all of a sudden it stopped sending notifications when a motion was detected or when it was disconnected. I spent an hour or so last night troubleshooting it, and found a forum thread that said resetting to factory defaults fixed it. So I did. Now I'm getting notifications every few minutes and can't make it stop. I've set the sensitivity to 15% and reduced the areas to only a small portion of the screen, but it is still saying there was a motion detected. My whole experience with this DLink product has been very frustrating. Their software is not very user friendly.

title: Great when it works (when it works)
text: I love the idea of this outdoor camera for our barn. It helps me keep real time tabs on what's happening with all our animals. However, it freezes a lot and requires a total reinstall of the app to get it working again.  But I have great peace of mind the 70% of the time it works.  I am unable to get a second camera up and running on the app even though I've read and reread the instructions.  Something happens in the implementation doesn't though the app that doesn't "take" with the second cam. That may be a D-Link problem but I'm working on it.

title: Good but not great
text: The app is sometimes slow to load. It also crashes and shuts down. I like the snap shot feature but would be nice if I could record. A contrast function would be nice. Or having different filters to help with light problems during the day. Streaming could be better. Its weird that my cams that are wireless stream better then my cams that are hard lined. I love a good stop motion film. But not when I want to know what's going on in or around my property. Over all like I said its ok for now but if app doesn't improve or add more features. I will have to find a better system.

title: Exceptionally good!
text: I am remodeling our beach house and cannot be onsite during the week. Have 2 cameras outside and 1 inside. App allows me to have real time status.  The house is in a fairly remote location with satellite internet service. I was worried about maintaining the connection but have had no problems.  The outside cameras have even functioned in the rain (this is probably not recommended). Will keep them active after construction so I can monitor water conditions and security.

title: Works just fine!
text:
We bought this camera for our daughters room. I'm unsure about what everyone is talking about but this device works just fine. I was out of state on business for a month while my husband cared for our daughter. I regularly logged in to see my daughter with no problems at all. *I think it all depends on your cell phone carrier and Internet.* The one time it did crash I had a weak signal. 

Easy set up
Easy installation
Easy viewing

title: Overall ok
text: Just installed (setup) 6 cameras. Had to call support which was not that great. I've been getting used the the app. I would like to see some of the advanced setting brought over to the app and not being forced to use a web browser. Once you get the hang of setting the cameras up and where to go it's not bad. My only other experience is using Foscams app which doesn't off much. I would like to see performance enhancements. Seems to run a little slow. However since this massive update to the server it seems to be a little smoother.

title: Meh
text: This app does most of what it needs to but is so restricted by technical limitations as to be nearly useless.  It does not run on Edge, the latest MS browser.  To use it from Windows 10 you must install an old version of IE.   It does not run on Linux at all.  The iPhone version of the app is limited in functionality compared to the desktop version.  But it works for most tasks.  I've been able to use it to learn about using remote cameras and all the intricacies and complications.  I've also learned that if you are going to do a lot of this you should pay more for real app.

title: One suggestion
text:
App is ok, although the frame rate at times can be extremely low even on high speed internet. One suggestion which I would like to see happen is that u can only gain access to the advanced settings through a computer, problem is that my computer is old and the browser does not support the camera so I cannot get to the settings. Can't understand why u can't do this through the app. I bought 2 cameras on the basis that I could set up and control everything through my iPhone. 
Would love to see this updated asap!

title: Good Product
text: Not perfect, but with a little tweaking it works as advertised. A novice user can use the provided GUI interface, while the advanced user can dive deeper into the camera setting via the IP Address Admin account. I lose connection every once and a while. I consider this to be a fairly normal occurrence as there are many variables that would cause this. Many d-link cameras have an option to have them automatically reboot once a day to help alleviate timeout issues. Wonderful, durable products. Highly recommended.

title: Works great! Want more cameras
text:
This app is easy to use and works really good. We originally purchased the cameras when kids were young and we wanted to keep an eye on them while we were out and the sitters were in charge. Loved it so much that we got more cameras added to "patrol" things when the cleaning girls are at the house. 
The really great thing is that I can also hear what is being said by the kids when I am not in the room! 
I want more cameras.

title: Looking Good!
text: We have been enjoying this camera for the past two weeks.  The initial install was a little more difficult than expected but the Customer service representative stayed on the phone with me until it was set up and fully functioning.  The issue was not with the camera but with the new wifi router we had also installed recently... I'd give their customer care an A+ for effort and patience.

title: It does what it's supposed to do.
text: I have had this app for a few months now and overall it works nicely. Every now and then the audio gets a little weird but I attribute that to connection issues.  Mostly I have this setup for my wife who is technically challenged. She loves how easy it is for her to work. For me the setup was easy and the product has met all of my expectations. Only 4 stars because I would like to be able to chose my timeout duration or simply remain live until I close the app.

title: Uses Internal Storage
text:
In speaking about functionality, this app works fine (for the most part).  There are times when it freezes, but overall it is satisfactory.  The real issue I have is that this app seemlingly stores video on your iDevice.  My wife and I uses our camera as a baby monitor and have the app running for quite awhile while we watch the little one sleep.  After a few days we noticed that the storage on our iDevice was full.  Even after deleting this app it still did not remove the cached video.  The ONLY way to do this is to restore your device.  The worst part of all is that there is no way to NOT cache the video.  

I suggest dlink clean up their app.

title: Doesn't work anymore.
text: The app simply does not work anymore. I just keep getting "bad device response" on Both me and my wife's iPhone. It barley worked in the first place. I warn anyone who's looking at this app because they are looking to purchase a DLink camera. Don't waste your money or time. You will spend days trying to resolve issues in which the customer service department is oblivious to. The developer for this app needs fired. Dlink take notice and fix this thing, otherwise it's just a $100 piece of useless plastic wasting electricity in my home. If someone breaks into my home, I sure as heck won't know about it, but hopefully they will steal this camera so they can deal with all the crap.

title: Avoid this garbage at all cost!!!!!
text:
This product design equipped with 4 obvious infrared  beams defeats the purpose of "home security." secondly, their so called (useless and worthless) techs are similar in nature to this crappy product. Word to the wise, beware of the "recommended" downloads and installation on your computer - nothin but spyware and malware sniffing out your data. The live stream works on my desktop because of their viral installation, however, the stream on my iPhone is DELYED! Did I mention the email notification alerts? I'll save my precious time. Ohhh, just as a FYI, I just returned this product at office max and the manager bluntly told me its a reoccurring event with this product. D-link, I'm very disappointed!!!!!! 

Disgruntled Customer-

title: Very good camera and app!
text: Although the d-link camera came with a installation CD, I was still able to install and configure the device without using it. If you do not have a desktop or laptop computer you can set it up without one with a little work. I'm able able to view my home via wifi. It also has audio and you are able to take stills. So right now I'm pleased with my product selection.

title: Great
text: This app and the cameras work perfectly for many cams for us. We have about 5-6 of them and all work well.  The only one that ever has connectivity problems is one that is a more functional camera (pan/zoom), though that could also be a wifi issue based on its distance from the router.  This is very reliable and I am always able to check in on my children and see how their day is going.  Excellent app!

title: Worked well before
text: I think the update messed mine up. My motion detection isn't working on either of my cameras now. Always has before. Tried resetting active zones and its not going off still. Also it wont allow me to access my wifi settings for the camera when i try to go in through live settings on my dlink app. Also i can not look at my cameras on the local setting anymore. Help please!

title: FIX NOW
text: I bought this camera to specifically use with my iPhone. This latest version works on my wifi, not on 3G. Completely useless for what bought the camera for. You basically sold me a camera, and then came into my house and broke it. I am not the only one to complain about this, and it has been broken for a month. Fix this now. I just bought another router, and bought a Cisco because of my bad experience. I plan on buying more cameras, and if this is not fixed by the time I do, I am throwing this Dlink into the trash and never buying another again. I wish I had the option to only give this version 0 stars, and that would be overrated.

title: App and Camera
text:
The app is not worth much without the camera.  The D-link cameras are first rate.  Set up is not entirely straight-forward but when I ran into problems the help line was excellent.  Once set up the camera and the app are excellent.  I've used a couple of alternatives and the D-link is the best match of price,features, and reliability.

I am using these cameras for a house we have out of the US and, once set up, it is the picture of reliability.

title: Pretty good overall
text:
I have purchased 4 D-link cameras over the last 3 years.   Overall I am pretty pleased with them.  I did have a few instances where getting them to connect to my wifi was a bit frustrating, but I guess firmware upgrades has made that an issue of the past.  
I am adding more to the exterior of my vacation home for peace of mind.  I just like checking in every now and again to see if all is well.  
For the price I am pleased with these units.

title: Great way to watch the family
text: So far me and my wife have used this app with six of the cameras and I found it very useful I am currently stationed in South Korea and I've been able to update firmware and see what's going on with family life in a moments notice due to this setup. I have not used the motion sensing function of it as kids tend set it off a lot but if I were to use it I have a feeling it would work as well as the rest.

title: Works sometimes
text: This app works sometimes, but picture quality is poor and sound rarely works. The :60 timer is annoying and begins running at log in so often by the time you are able to view the picture, you have less than :45 seconds to view your camera. I would rather pay for an upgrade which is better and more consistent than have these quirky issues on a free app. Apparently none of the paid apps are any better. I'd buy additional cameras if the app worked better.

title: Needs work - Mac users beware
text: Why do companies claim compatibility on Mac computers when it's not the case? Video will not record to micro SD card which is what I need and purchased the camera for. Motion detection and push notifications are intermittent even when set to occur. I've noticed once you sign out of iPhone app push notifications turn off, and you are not notified. When I log back into app the push motivations are off. Even worse you can't control motion detection and push notifications from the computer at all. The live video feed works good, but I need the recording feature to work.

title: Works great
text: The app has been great so far. I bought 2 cameras.. Setting them up was incredibly easy! The app sometimes take a minute to load but some patience makes it tolerable and not a big deal. The cameras seem to have a lot of static when the sound is on, which I have read seems to be a common issue.
