That of course is not a reflection of the app. App is super easy to use and set up really well too. Happy with my purchase of the camera and the easy usage of the app.

title: Works for the first time on Jan 25.
text:
Didn't realize the app was updated on the same day! Previous day couldn't get iPhone app to connect w camera. Next day the app on the iPad had noProb connecting. After that the iPhone connected too. There is a timeout error once awhile but might be linked to my slow internet remotely. Or not since others have reported same prob. Hope it will work on 4g or LTE too one day. 

iPad version allows recording. iPhone only to view live feed of audio and video which is beyond my expectation.

title: Great D-link Product!
text: I use it all the time!  Works great!  Example use:  There is not much to say except this is a great piece of work!  Works great!  I have a security camera in the back of the garage facing the door and can see the inside of the garage and so when I'm away, I can check it and open/close it for others while I'm away in case the need arises while I'm away, sY on vacation.  Like I say, a great piece of work on the part of Sears engineers!  :)

title: Does its job well
text: I use mine as a baby monitor. I like that it alerts me when there is movement because I tend not to leave my phone on the video the entire time baby is sleeping. It'd be nice if it could run in the background...so I can listen to music while watching at the same time. Other than that it works great (every great software has its moments of downtime) and I love that I only have to take my phone with me. Not a separate piece of equipment. There's also no range max like regular monitors.

title: Absolutely useless
text: We got this camera as a gift. We're using it to monitor our baby while he's sleeping in his crib at night. This app consistently freezes, loses video feed, doesn't even connect half the time, and has error after error. This is supposed to be a device to give us peace if mind, not make us worried that what's on the screen isn't actually what's happening in real time. It would be nice if I can open the app and trust that what I'm looking at is actually my infant son safely sleeping and not a frozen shot of him from ten minutes ago, and really he's in there wide awake. And now I see bad review after bad review on here....Get your s#*t together, d-link!

title: Works good
text: Had a little trouble hooking up the camera to my range extender for wifi but I used my laptop and configured it while using my range extender wifi signal. I was able to configure and them move the camera to its final location. Works good signal is a bit slow but considering my main wifi router is about 250ft away. Worth the money it's a great camera for the money and the app works great!

title: Nice app despite the reviews
text:
Ok so maybe I'm a lucky person or I just know how to set up the camera properly but my camera is working perfectly and I love the fact that I can view my baby when I'm not home. I do wish that there were some preset buttons but the basic functions work great and both me and my wife have the app installed on our iphone 4 and 4s and they work fine. 
I'm now installing a second camera. We'll see if this one works just as good..

title: Camera controls very difficult to use
text:
I agree with the other reviewers, the new camera controls are difficult to use. Please revert to the original "step" increment adjustments. They worked fine, are straight forward, and easy to use. No need to depart from that interface.

That said, I have used this app and cameras for over a year and the system works well.  Sensitivity to shadows etc. tend to present false positives but on balance this is manageable.

title: New update fixes crashes for me
text:
Thanks! I just bought this camera (DCS 930L) and installed this app last week and could not use it as it crashes a few seconds after you viewed your camera. This was especially true when you were not under your local wifi where I seemed to work just fine.

The new update is much more stable for me, no crashes at all so far.

title: No complaints whatsoever
text:
Worked as needed over an AT&T velocity hotspot using its native wifi. Response to pan and tilt a little slow but I'd blame that on the connection. iOS app a little less capable than the Windows portal but still completely functional. Device has been reliable during power resets in re-connection. 
Would be nice to have a video inversion feature for upside down mounting. Tilt down angle is limited.

title: Great cameras, app needs work.
text:
Everything works fine. I have had no problems on my iPhone 4S. 
Would like to see a couple of changes in the app. One, the pan tilt zoom could be smoother. Second, I would like to see several cameras on the same screen. Currently I can only see one at a time. That's frustrating because if I want to scan through them, I tap on one, then have to go back to the main camera menu and select another and so on.

title: Work out the kinks
text: We were very excited to use this camera and app after we saw a friend have one. At first we were very happy with it with no issues. But after a few updates the image has frozen up and locks up without warning and making it impossible to hear or see. And there are times when the silent feature won't turn on in the event of our baby crying. So now we have this camera on but using a sound monitor as a backup. Thank goodness we did or our crying alert would not work while we slept. Work out the kinks and this could be great.

title: I can't believe this is possible!
text:
It is amazing to be able to view my cameras anywhere that I have wifi or 3G access. The app works without a hiccup. I get about 5 fps at 320x240 over 3G and about 9 frames per second on wifi off site (768kbps uplink dsl is holding this back). 

It's true there is no sound--seems like it is something that could be added in the future.

But I am very happy and the app and camera have both been rock solid. 

To the folks who complain about the video cutting out: you're doing it wrong. You either need a upnp router or you need to forward ports to the camera to enable streaming for more than one minute at a time. 

Can't wait to see what's next, d-link!

title: Impressed
text:
Just got a D link camera to monitor my living room since I had 2 burglaries in the last 3 weeks. Installation was simple and the app although slow at first has really impressed me. 
The app allows for push notifications and will seamlessly refresh the videos triggered by motion and sound. It's very easy to use and although the loading/ applying takes longer (10-15secs) more than expected it works very well. 

Very impressed.

title: Dcs933l, works well but needs some minor changes
text: Overall it does what it says. It does lag a bit but that doesn't matter if I'm not home. The updates take forever. It's not the app itself updating through the App Store, it's the system itself. After taking almost 30 minutes to set it up on my phone, it's actually not bad and I can see everything that's going on. No issues with the night time mode either

title: Good App For the price
text: Depending on your internet or cell signal will determine your opinion.   When I am connected to my home network the app works perfect .  At my office it all depends on cell strength and time of day.  Most of the time it works fine.  For the best dependability you will need to keep the firmware up to date on your cameras.  When the app will not behave or locks up on me - I just un-install then re-install and this fixes the the problem at least 95% of the time.

title: What happened?????
text: This worked with my camera until this morning.  I have a DCS-932L.  Now when I open the app there's a big question mark over my camera and I can't access it.  The help function says "This may appear for cameras in your Device List that are not yet supported by the current version of the mydlink Lite app.  If you see this icon, try checking for a newer version of the mydlink Lite app."  But I have the most current version.  I only bought this camera two weeks ago.  I use it to check in on my pets from my iPhone 4.  Now I can't use it for the purpose I bought it for.  Please fix this problem ASAP!!!!!!

title: Major Privacy Concerns with 2.6.0
text: Well here is a fun thing I just discovered...something in 2.6.0 for iPhone has disabled the flashing notification light on my cameras when viewing them! This means I have no idea if someone is viewing the cameras! What a horrifying security concern. The camera lights blink when being viewed from the iPad version of the app and from the web interface, just not the MyDLink Lite 2.6.0 for iPhone. And here I thought their inability to spell anything in the app correctly was a big deal. I'd say my privacy trumps all other issues. I'm contemplating taking all of my cameras back because of this. Who knows when someone is watching?!

title: Are U Listening?
text: The app was solid throughout its own version updates and iOS upgrades until this last. As so many have stated, I too use my cams to monitor my infant son. However, the recent changes have negatively impacted viewing stability rendering the app unreliable and useless. Dlink, do you care that your loyalty base needs help and is turning to the competition due to your apparent indifference and unresponsiveness to these complaints. Pretty silly reason for a business that strives to be #1 in the category. I hope this is corrected soon, otherwise expect Trendnet and Linksys to continue eroding marketshare.

title: In love
text: Finally broke down and called for help and got it and more. Got my cameras updated and working wirelessly again. I love seeing what my 3 dogs are up to when I'm at work. I can place them anywhere now and I plan on getting more of them now I'm not limited to the number of ports on my router. The sky is the limit. Mine are a couple years old and the new ones are able to pan and tilt. Great support,great price.

title: App and camera is worthless
text: If I could I would give this app and the camera both a zero star rating because both are worthless. The camera is the biggest waste of money and the app is just as worthless. The camera and app aren't even worthy of receiving a single star rating, I would never recommend this app or camera to anyone I know ever. Don't get these cameras if your looking for any type of security cameras because your just wasting your money and won't have the first bit of reliable cameras to depend on. D link products aren't worth any money from the experiences I've had with their stuff......

title: I wouldn't buy it again
text: I have had one camera now for about 2 months and it now will not let me view anything on the playback. This has been going on for about a week now and I still can't get it to play back anything. It either says the connection was lost or the SD card is not inserted properly. My feeling is that it is a complete waist of money and the start up was difficult. The directions claim an easy start up, but it took us a day for it to finally connect and start working. It doesn't always allow you to view the live feed. Poor is an understatement for this app and camera.

title: Pretty light weight but good for for basic usage
text:
Edit: I am changing my original review and adding an extra star. I was wrong about the advanced features not being a part of the application. Advanced features are there. I just couldn't find the settings in the app.

MyDlink Lite is a pretty good app. I wish that there were thumbnail views of all of my cameras. Hopefully it will be added in an update. I had a few crashes but nothing consistent.

title: Audio not working anymore
text: The camera was working great for the first day or two. I like the features it does have. Picture quality is okay nothing too great. But now for some reason the audio will not work on my iPhone but will on my husbands iphone.. I've reset the camera, deleted and re downloaded the app, reset my modem, I've done all troubleshooting steps and still no luck.. not good since I bought this to view my baby when I'm doing stuff in a different room or outside. I have to constantly watch the screen to make sure she isn't crying.. I hope you guys send an update soon if not I'm returning

title: Please Change the Camera Controls Back!
text:
App worked satisfactorily before latest update were changes were intended to make moving the camera 'easier'. Now the camera moves when I am trying to
Zoom in, and it has woken my daughter up several times when the camera pans accidentally. New controls are NOT more convenient and are really annoying!!! Please change them back!

Also...when I have the app OPEN, I still get alerts on my phone with regard to movement/noise from my baby. The badges then obstruct my view of my child! Why would I need an alert if I have the app open and  am watching?! Grrr.

title: Excellent way to monitor your home
text:
I love being able to see what's going on at home any time I need to no matter where I am.

I was afraid that the connection might not do as well when not connected to WiFi but I've tested it on LTE and 3G and both work just fine. Reliability probably depends more on your wireless service provider and the type of phone or tablet you have. 

The only configuration I had to do was to update the firmware on my phone. That involved pressing the OK button twice. No big deal. 

Dlink can also stream your camera(s) over their website if you enable that feature. 

The app (or at least the version I have) does not allow you to record, but you can take screenshots.

title: Crashes, lack of sound and more disappointments
text: We bought a DCS5222 camera because of the ability to view from our phones. The audio and microphones were selling features. Unfortunately both are useless. My iphone5 is unable to hear audio (although my setting says it's turned on) and when I click the mic icon it continues to "think" which leads to eventually freezing the app. I was hoping the new update would fix this issue...although it appears it did not fix anything. The app still times out frequently. Looks like dlink needs an update to their update!

title: Review Removed and App Still Does Not Work On LTE!
text: I just wrote and updated my review today and now it has been DELETED by the developer!  Talk about CENSORSHIP!  If you would fix your product so it works as advertised I would write a positive review.  Still can't access my cameras via LTE. I can only access via my home WiFi.  All of my devices and phones are running current firmware and iOS.  So what's the problem?  In case you missed the point,  FIX THE APP PLEASE!  We can send Voyager 1 and 2 out of the Solar System and still communicate with them and I'm sure this simple app could be fixed to work over LTE.  This is nothing new.

title: Improved
text:
Great improvement in loading speed, which I really like. No problems with freezing on my i5 as others have reported. The only downside to this update is that the snapshot button does not work on my i5.
Update - Now the entire app has quit working on both iPhone 5 and iPad!!! All I get is the question mark symbol on all cameras like they are no longer supported.  I am out of town and unable to see anything at home. Need a speedy fix.

title: Works but not as advertised.
text:
I have a DCS932LB. It's a very simple camera model. You can't change where it points. 

The app does fine showing what the camera sees, both on my local network and remotely. The app claims to let you change camera settings for motion and sound detection but that does not work. I have only been able to do it via the camera's website. Since I will not open any router ports to the outside, that means I can only change settings when I am home.

title: Functional, needs improvement
text:
Push notifications make it easy to monitor activity at home while I'm away‚Äîbut streaming live video is difficult even over a high-speed WiFi connection and many of my cameras' settings are not adjustable via the app. 

Noise detection is not adjustable at all and it would be far more convenient if I could toggle motion detection for a group of cameras at once rather than navigating multiple screens to adjust motion settings for each camera individually.

title: Could be better
text:
App work as described. Installation I would say is not for beginners however it can be followed easily if you go step by step using the wizzard option.

Rated as 4 stars coz it can only stream 1 video/channel per window or screen. I think DLink as a renowned company can do much better in developing apps for cams/ videos compared to other apps and cams out there that can stream 2 or more videos/ cams simultaneously and yet from a generic brands.

title: Awesome product!!!
text: I got mine over a year ago to monitor the house when we were away so we could monitor the cat sitter to make sure she was coming in when scheduled to feed the cats and clean the litter box. I love the peace of mind of knowing when someone's in the house and to be able at anytime to check in. The peace of mind is well worth the price, some protection is better than no protection!!!!

title: D-Link Never Changed
text: I knew I had this uneasy feeling about dealing with D-link after I stopped being a customer back in the early 2000s after years of dealing with complicated & cumbersome routers. Yet, I tried to give them a second change with a low priced camera. Unfortunately, there is still the same persistent problem, poor products and a quick return on my money for them with a weak 30 day guarantee! I am returning this camera after only getting it to work on my computer & not the app. The D-link app never picked up my camera but the OWLR did, yet the OWLR won't let me log in! It's a ridiculous fate.

title: Works well. No issues
text:
I like the app. For what I paid the quality of the camera is ok. Does what I bought it for and if I want better quality id have to spend a lot more. 

The app is great. No connectivity issues. It allows me to modify the camera for motion or sound detection. As well as email notification. And they all worked fine for me and my iPhone 5s and laptop.

title: Disappointing
text: Bought this unit from a big box store as a solution and supplement to checking in on someone with early onset Alzheimer's. Starting point instructions were confusing and misleading to a network novice.  But on the app side it freezes and closes after about 6 seconds on both the Lite version and the Plus versions on both iOS phone and iPad running latest OS. Timing of the release of fix could be an issue. But removing the older version of the the app from the device and red loading it from the App Store only results in getting the same version with the same problems. Really?

title: Good app when it works
text: I have a DCS-933L, overall I like the camera. But the app on the other hand isn't very reliable. I would say it works about 75% of the time, if I had to chose again I would of went with a better product and a paid app so all the glitches would be fixed. After all you get what you pay for, and this free app needs a lot of work. Most importantly I just downloaded there new update version 3.5 and now it crashes every time I open it. You think the person that developed the update would like test it out?!?!!!

title: Great
text:
Have been using it for several years.... initially had some issues with dropping signal but recently much more stable.  Still have one location that keeps loosing signal connection despite repositioning of repeater.  If you are having problems the last tech support recommended reinstalling from scratch on all your cameras and that seem to stabilize almost all cameras. 
GK

title: Too hard to adjust cameras
text: Ever since they made the update where you have to swipe the screen to move your camera, it's incredibly frustrating and hard to use - especially on an iPhone. I want to move the camera just a step at a time to adjust it, and now I'm guessing at where the thing will go if I so much as bump it trying to swipe. You should have kept the old method in addition to your new swipe feature so that if we preferred to adjust the old way we could. Not to mention the app times out all the time!

title: SO FRUSTRATING!!!
text:
***COMPLETELY STOPPED WORKING!! Nothing helps, I've tried EVERYTHING to get it to work. Deleted the app and reinstalled, restarted my phone.  I'm REALLY getting tired of this app not working. Might almost be worth it to buy a whole different camera. 

We use this app as a child monitor in our 2 year olds room. Every night after I put him to bed I open the app to check on him and it's frozen, then closes itself after a few seconds. The only way I've found to fix it is to shut down my whole phone. I even tried deleting and reinstalling the app. Really wish they could fix this app. I use it daily. What a pain!

title: Works like a charm
text: I don't understand the negative reviews here. This works like a charm and no major setup required. Identifying the right camera is a bit tedious (sometimes the scan does not bring up the right camera so i had to select it by trial and error) but eventually it just works. I love it so much I am going to buy few more of it. I have email, ftp configured as well.

title: Dcs 2630l works great
text:
I love the features but have not tried them all. The live view and microphone works well to speak through unit. I have not tried the recording/ playback of video, movement location recording or sound activated recording yet. 
The night vision works great in nearly complete darkness( looks like it's black and white video )
So far I'm satisfied. 
I'm thinking about getting 2 more.

title: Easy Enough
text: The app itself is simple so don't expect a lot of bells & whistles those are embedded within camera.  After buying 2 cheap D-Link models I needed a PTZ night vision cam with motion detection to serve multiple purposes. Works great keeping an eye on elderly mom in one city and a non-PTZ with night vision in another city. The App's remote cam feature is good enough and meets all my needs. For the price ($0) you cannot beat it!

title: Quick, convenient, and very useful.
text: The ease of use of this App makes it a very effective way to monitor my property while away from it. Paired up with my iPhone I am easily able to keep up to date on the security of my house while away from it. The cameras are simple to adjust remotely. The security provided by motion detection with immediate notification is immeasurable. Highly recommended.

title: It's ok, hopefully they support Audio in a near future.!!
text:
Installation with ethernet cable is easy and fast.  It was a little complicated to set up for wireless usage. I had to spend two hours with customer support, and as another user mentioned, they are not very friendly. 
Hopefully they could come up with a new APP version to support audio as well. It's a good solution if you work in an office and you have access to a PC all the time. From you iPhone is not good enough.

title: Doesn't work on iPhone5
text:
As of last night, this app stopped working on iPhone5 devices. It seems like the developers cannot stay ahead of or even on top of updates, crashes and glitches. It's pretty bad.

IF they can get that fixed...a good feature add on would be to be able to turn off the video and only listen to audio, so it doesn't drain a device battery so much and also so users who use it as a baby monitor don't have to keep a glowing screen going all night in their bedrooms. Currently, you must keep the video on if you want to use this on a mobile device. Super inconvenient.
